FuncDef: The reset ospf suppress-flapping peer command configures an interface to exit OSPF neighbor relationship flapping suppression. The reset ospf suppress-flapping peer command configures an interface to exit OSPF neighbor relationship flapping suppression.
CLIs: reset ospf <process-id> suppress-flappingpeer [ <interface-name> [ all-areas | area { <area-id> | <area-id-ipv4> } ] | <interface-type> <interface-number> [ all-areas | area { <area-id> | <area-id-ipv4> } ] ]

reset ospf <process-id> suppress-flappingpeer [ <interface-name> [ all-areas | area { <area-id> | <area-id-ipv4> } ] | <interface-type> <interface-number> [ all-areas | area { <area-id> | <area-id-ipv4> } ] ] notify-peer

ParaDef.Info:
process-id Specifies the ID of an OSPF process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Clears statistics of all OSPF areas.
-

Specifies an area ID in the format of a decimal integer.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Specifies an area ID in the format of an IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Instructs neighbors to exit from OSPF neighbor relationship flapping suppression too.
-
